tweets.text: Just to remind you all that just 24 hours ago the @EnvAgency admitted it will no longer be publishing serious pollution incidents and won't be recording them against their annual performance targets. https://t.co/Cu3VPjycTa

Huge thanks to our contractors for helping us to establish much needed scrub along this beck in the Glenderamackin catchment - helping to #slowtheflow, provide habitat and create pockets of shade to keep watercourses cool when temperatures rise. Funded by #WEG and @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/5wXlf1uuAv

Did you know, after #flooding, our Fisheries specialists search for stranded #fish?

Today, we‚Äôve been checking around the River Idle on the #NorthNotts #SouthYorkshire border. 

If you see any stranded fish, contact us at 0800 807060. 

#Doncaster #floods https://t.co/oWsZOmVTOu

In the last 24 hours #Cumbria has seen 65% of it's rainfall for the month

Our teams continue to be out in Cumbria clearing grids to #ReduceFloodRisk 

Have you signed up for flood warnings in your area? Keep up to date with the latest & sign up here ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/ZPNKETcukX https://t.co/h6ZaPIzOTu

Rain üåßÔ∏è is still expected throughout the day in #Cumbria. Stay safe, always keep your distance from swollen rivers and don‚Äôt drive through flood water. 

just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car üöó

#Prepareactsurvive https://t.co/ruBakdutZ9

The @EnvAgency offers a free #flood warning service that enables people in flood warning areas to receive #flood alerts and warnings by telephone, text and email, even if you are not at home when they are sentüíß. 

Check if you're eligible by following the instructions below ‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/go7pU41Vd3

The @EnvAgencyYNE  #SheafScreen in #Sheffield is coming along nicely.

Most of the major civils works are now complete and control panels installed, next steps are the debris grabs, electrical wiring, welfare provision and the final user testing. 

Due for completion mid 2021. https://t.co/w70e6NwrdI

Today @EnvAgency launches its 10 yr monitoring report into #ClimateEmergency related changes to the #Thames Estuary. By incorporating findings to the @TE2100Plan we are adapting to a more #ClimateResilient future. #TogetherForOurPlanet #RaceToResilience
https://t.co/Y9mD2SZ2zl https://t.co/JhF760gcsB

tweets.text: @GreenFeltham @CranfordAction @EnvAgency @thameswater @Thames21 @SE_Rivers_Trust We aren't insured to be running any clean ups currentlyüò∑. And it still comes down to removing for disposalü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

Southern Water is the worst performing water company in the country, failing on a number of measures. Useful to meet with @EnvAgencySE to discuss constituent concerns on pollution in our bathing waters and actions to hold the water company to account

@Plasmadreamer @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Is it too much to ask, expect for the right thing to be done. I'm no expert I will openly admit, I just film underwater in rivers, it's all I do, not much I know, in my eyes something will give if it is not tackled. Don't we owe it to ourselves to clean up. Nothing is impossible

@UnderwaterMedia @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency üëçyou have hit the nail on the head. That is the true definition of pollution, wrong material, wrong place. When houses flood with sewage because of infrastructure under-capacity urgent investment nearly always follows. Rivers......impact nobody‚Äôs homes directlyü§¨

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Say this again. If the same amount of sewage flowed down each individual highstreets action would be taken, but a river it is deemed acceptable as people don't care, its not their problem. When we loose what we have remember you was warned. This really boils my p**s

urls.title: Flood Alert, Flood Warning and Severe Flood Warning ‚Äì What‚Äôs the difference? | Newground
urls.description: Recently, I saw a poll on Twitter set up to help the Environment Agency understand people‚Äôs interpretation of flood risk, which is one of the reasons I decided to write this blog. Out of the 1,199 people who voted on the poll, I was quite shocked to find that 51% of voters thought a Flood Alert meant that you were at a higher risk of flooding than a Flood Warning. This is NOT the case. Raising awareness of the flood alerts and warning system and what each stage means is key to educating people and

urls.title: Escape to the canal in 60 seconds | Canal & River Trust
urls.description: When times are stressful, our canals and rivers can be a haven of peace and calm. Even if you can't get to the towpath, our virtual visits bring waterside tranquility right into your living room.

urls.title: Am I at Risk? | The Flood Hub
urls.description: 1 in 6 properties in England are at risk of flooding from rivers, sea and surface water, with many others susceptible to various sources of flooding. This number is only set to increase due to climate change, making the need for you as a property owner to check your own risk ever more important. A variety of information is available to help you check your flood risk, from online data maps to risk management information, giving you a head start to prepare your property for potential flooding.

urls.title: Environment Agency silent on removal of pollution goal from performance report
urls.description: The Environment Agency will not be drawn on why it has dropped a target to reduce the number of pollution incidents from a regular report on its performance against environmental objectives, despite requests for an explanation from ENDS.

tweets.text:
Me: So @EnvAgency, why have you taken pollution incidents and a target to reduce them out of your performance reports?
EA: We'll get back to you on that.
Me: *twiddles thumbs*
Me: Helloooo? Is anyone there?
EA:ü§ê
https://t.co/Tqd9MZUd24
Is this true @EnvAgency? And what on earth is the rationale behind such a damaging decision? https://t.co/2bsOSQGQBY
